#Text=Massive earthquake hits Indonesia , no tsunami risk
#Text=Wednesday , April 11 , 2012
#Text=An 8.6 magnitude earthquake occurred off the Indonesian coast at 08:38:37 UTC today , causing a tsunami watch to be issued over the entire Indian Ocean .

#Text=According to the U.S. Geological Survey , the quake struck at a point 308 miles ( 495 km ) southwest of Banda Aceh , the provincial capital , located on the northern extremity of the country 's Sumatra island , at a depth of 20.5 miles ( 33 km ) .
#Text=Local media reports suggest that people in Sumatra fled from their homes and offices in fear .
#Text=The 8.6 quake was followed by a quake measuring 8.2 on the Richter Scale .
#Text=The Pacific Tsunami Warning Center ( PTWC ) advised authorities to " take appropriate action " , stating that they were not aware whether a tsunami had occurred yet .
#Text=The earthquake , initially believed to be 8.9 on the Richter Scale was later revised to be an 8.7 and finally an 8.6 quake .
#Text=In reaction to the earthquake , the Indonesian disaster management agency noted that power had been shut down in Aceh .
#Text=Moreover , people were being warned by sirens of the danger and were going to higher ground .
#Text=Agency spokesman Sutopo said : "

#Text=They mentioned that  [ e]arthquakes of this size have the potential to generate a widespread destructive tsunami that can affect coastlines across the entire Indian Ocean basin .

#Text=The tsunami warnings were initially issued for Indonesia after the 8.6 earthquake and later issued for a further two hours after the 8.2 earthquake hit the Aceh province .

#Text=Later , India too ended its tsunami watch , with a scientist at the Indian tsunami warning center noting that  the danger has passed " .

column1: #Text=Earlier , the tremors were felt as far away as Bangkok in Thailand and south India , particularly in Bangalore and Chennai .
#Text=According to locals , people left their buildings in Bangalore on feeling the tremors .
#Text=The Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Service issued a red high-level warning for the Andaman and Nicobar Islands .
#Text=The southeastern coasts of Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu were put on lower warnings .
#Text=According to Sky News , people residing near the coast were asked to move away from the sea in India .
#Text=The tremors there reached upto the northern city of Kolkata .
#Text=Kolkata and its surrounding areas felt tremors , also felt in North 24 Parganas and the town of Siliguri in the same state .
#Text=Several people rushed out of their office as windows and doors rattled due to the quake , while some buildings developed cracks .
#Text=Metro Rail services were suspended in the city , and people were asked to leave the stations .
#Text=Similar warnings were issued by the governments in Sri Lanka , where mild tremors were experienced at Colombo .
#Text=The tsunami warning was however lifted after 6 p.m. local time .
#Text=But the government advised people not to go close to the sea .
#Text=Smith Dhamasoroja , of the National Disaster Warning Foundation , predicted that Thailand would have to face a tsunami as the earthquake was so powerful .
#Text=Thai Meteorological Department deputy chief Somchai Baimoung however stated that no warning had yet been issued .
#Text=Later a warning was issued in the country and subsequently lifted .
#Text=In Bangladesh , two tremors were felt .
#Text=But the authorities stated there was no fear of a tsunami .
#Text=Amy Vaughn of the U.S. Geological Survey told Sky News that because the earthquake was so massive , " a large body of water is disturbed by the movement of the fault " .
#Text=Therefore , since the epicenter was so close to the west coast of Sumatra , " it could be devastating for the region .
